title: 109_s403
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" may be cited as the short title. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits knowingly transporting a minor across state lines to obtain an abortion, violating parental involvement laws. Offenders may face fines or imprisonment. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent or judicial authorization, except in cases where the minor's life is endangered by a physical condition related to the pregnancy. Transporting a minor in violation of this law will not result in prosecution or lawsuits for the minor or her parents. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent or judicial authorization. An affirmative defense is available if the defendant reasonably believed that the necessary consent or notification had been obtained. Parents can seek civil action for harm caused by a violation of the act, except in cases of incest. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines a law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision as one that mandates parental notification or consent before the procedure, without alternative options. The term "parent" includes a parent, guardian, legal custodian, or a person standing in loco parentis. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines a law requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision as one that mandates parental notification or consent before the procedure. It includes a person standing in loco parentis who has care and control of the minor and with whom the minor regularly resides. The term "minor" refers to an individual not older than the maximum age requiring parental notification or consent under the law. The Act also covers transportation of minors in circumvention of abortion laws. The "Child Custody Protection Act" mandates parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision, including transportation across state lines for the procedure. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits taking minors across state lines to circumvent laws requiring parental involvement in abortion decisions.
